officers.title: President
officers.name: Pierce Smith
officers.bio: Hey there! I'm a junior CS major here at CSU. Security on the Internet has been very important to me for a large portion of my life, so I am delighted to be a part of this club and have the opportunity to share how we should best practice it. When I'm not ranting about programming, I love drawing, doing graphic design, writing stories, and re-playing Half-Life for the 50th time.
responsibilities: Lead meetings and delegate tasks to officers

officers.title: Vice President
officers.name: Chloe Hesskamp
officers.bio: I am a freshman undergraduate student at CSU studying computer science and mathematics.  I became interested in cybersecurity through math and am especially interested in learning more about cryptography and cryptanalysis.  One of my goals is to spread awareness of cybersecurity to a broad audience.  When I am not programming, I enjoy playing the violin and reading.
responsibilities: Lead meetings and delegate tasks to officers

officers.title: Webmaster
officers.name: Ethan Pauly
officers.bio: I am a freshman here at CSU studying Computer Science. Joined this club to learn more about cybersecurity, and during my term as Webmaster I aim to add some spice to the current website. Things I enjoy doing are eating, playing video games, playing guitar, and cooking.
responsibilities: Update topic information with urls and notes

officers.title: Sys Admin
officers.name: Britta Maher
officers.bio: I am an undergraduate freshman majoring in Computer Science at CSU. I participated in many different technology clubs such as Cyber Patriot and the First Tech Challenge during high school, and discovered my interest in cyber security through Cyber Patriot and Girls Go Cyber. I continued my pursuit of cybersecurity by joining Hashdump. I spend a lot of my free time going to hackathons, online conferences, reading or taking care of my plants.
responsibilities: Create educational demos with our systems
Assist and supervise any projects a club member wants to do with our systems

officers.title: Secretary
officers.name: Jack Sovereign
officers.bio: I’m a sophomore at CSU studying computer science. I’ve had an interest in cybersecurity for years, but never really knew where to learn more about it until I found this club! I’m excited to learn more about it and share my knowledge with others throughout the upcoming year. If I’m not studying, I like hiking, camping, watching movies, and listening to music.

officers.title: Treasurer
officers.name: Enzo Barret
officers.bio: Hello! I'm a freshman music performance major at CSU (trumpet), soon to be a CS double major. I love all things cyber security and enjoy being a member of this club. Some of by other hobbies include photography, music, and sailing. As treasurer this year I will be adjusting everything in the buget for being virtual!

officers.title: Academic Advisor
officers.name: Dr. Joseph Gersch
officers.bio: Dr. Gersch is an instructor at CSU, the former president of Secure64 Software Corporation, and a 24-year HP veteran. His current research includes systems and network security, blockchain, security analytics, and visualization. As our principle advisor, Dr. Gersch is brimming with knowledge and experience, and is always happy to share it.

officers.title: Graduate Advisor
officers.name: Jordan Peterson
officers.bio: Jordan is a second-year grad student working towards a Master of Science in Computer Science at CSU. He is also a veteran of the Hashdump club, being a member since his undergrad and having held different officer positions in the club since 2016. His current research focuses on security within the ever-growing Internet of Things.
